title: How to Make Old Fashioned Bread Pudding

steps.headline: Take about 1/2-2/3 of a loaf of bread (of your choosing, of course, though wheat bread works better than white bread, as it stays together better), and  cut it into 1-1 1/2 inch cubes.
Grease a 2 quart baking dish (PAM spray is perfect for this, just give the baking dish a good enough spray-down that you cover the inside in a nice, thin film of grease/cooking spray).
Place the bread cubes into your greased baking dish and set aside for now.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk and slightly-beaten eggs.
Now stir in your sugar, melted butter, raisins, and (optionally) lemon peel.
steps.description: Make sure the ingredients are well mixed, of course!

steps.headline: Pour the mixture carefully over the bread cubes in your greased baking dish and sprinkle with nutmeg.
steps.description: This mixture should almost (but not quite) cover the bread cubes, and will also be very close to the rim of the baking dish, so be careful when moving the mixture in the following steps! !

steps.headline: Place the 2 quart baking dish into the larger one, and fill the larger one up to about an inch with water (this helps keep the pudding from over-cooking on the outside while also working with the cooking spray to help keep the pudding from getting too sticky in the baking dish).
steps.description: Don't using cold water, as it will be going into a hot oven shortly, and the temperature difference could potentially crack or break the large baking dish, spilling water everywhere. Instead, use hot or lukewarm water to reduce the chances of this happening to you.

steps.headline: Place the entire thing - 2 quart (the smaller of the two) baking dish inside larger one - into the oven and bake for 1 hour.
When the timer goes off, remove the baking dishes from the oven, but leave the oven on.
steps.description: The pudding should still not be set, and now you must take the smaller of the two baking dishes and put it back in the oven for another 30-35 minutes.

steps.headline: After this time, the pudding should be done.
steps.description: Allow it to cool before serving, then enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Take about 1/2-2/3 of a loaf of bread (of your choosing, of course, though wheat bread works better than white bread, as it stays together better), and  cut it into 1-1 1/2 inch cubes.  Grease a 2 quart baking dish (PAM spray is perfect for this, just give the baking dish a good enough spray-down that you cover the inside in a nice, thin film of grease/cooking spray).  Place the bread cubes into your greased baking dish and set aside for now.  In a large mixing bowl, combine the milk and slightly-beaten eggs.  Now stir in your sugar, melted butter, raisins, and (optionally) lemon peel. Make sure the ingredients are well mixed, of course! Pour the mixture carefully over the bread cubes in your greased baking dish and sprinkle with nutmeg. This mixture should almost (but not quite) cover the bread cubes, and will also be very close to the rim of the baking dish, so be careful when moving the mixture in the following steps! ! Place the 2 quart baking dish into the larger one, and fill the larger one up to about an inch with water (this helps keep the pudding from over-cooking on the outside while also working with the cooking spray to help keep the pudding from getting too sticky in the baking dish). Don't using cold water, as it will be going into a hot oven shortly, and the temperature difference could potentially crack or break the large baking dish, spilling water everywhere. Instead, use hot or lukewarm water to reduce the chances of this happening to you. Place the entire thing - 2 quart (the smaller of the two) baking dish inside larger one - into the oven and bake for 1 hour.  When the timer goes off, remove the baking dishes from the oven, but leave the oven on. The pudding should still not be set, and now you must take the smaller of the two baking dishes and put it back in the oven for another 30-35 minutes. After this time, the pudding should be done. Allow it to cool before serving, then enjoy!
